item.title: Clojure: Mahout's 'entropy' function
item.description: As I mentioned in a coupleof previous postsJenand I have been playing around with Mahout random forestsand for a few hours last week we spent some time looking through the code to see how it worked. In particular we came across an entropy function which is used to determine how good a particular ‘split’ point in a decision tree is going to be. I quite like the following definition: Information Theory (developed by Claude Shannon 1948) defines this value of uncertainty as entropy, a probability-based measure used to calculate the amount of uncertainty.
